node.title: Got your vax certificate ready? It's a lot harder for some and is causing anxiety
node.alt: Three women playing mahjong at a table. A fourth player is not visible in the photo
node.description: Some older Australians say they need help to use their smartphones to check in at venues and to provide their COVID vaccination certificate, but others don't even own a smartphone.
node.content:
["While using your smartphone to check in or show your vaccination certificate is second nature for most, for others it presents a challenge, especially as states prepare to reopen borders and people start travelling again.", "There are concerns that with the increasing reliance on smartphones, the digital divide is also increasing between those who are tech savvy and those who struggle.", "It is a real fear for some visiting the Mathers House community space in Hobart, where the lunchtime rush is building.", "It's a place where older people come for a good feed and to connect with friends over activities ranging from mahjong to burlesque to IT classes.", "At the front door, volunteer Helen Vojacek sits ready to help check people in\u00a0with an iPad to enter details into for those who do not have a smartphone.", "\"Some of the really, really old people, they've never been used to technology and it's a big step for them and a different way of thinking and getting used to what they have to do,\" she said.\u00a0", "\"And they're easily thrown if it doesn't work.\"", "", "
Helen Vojacek helps to check people in to Hobart's Mathers House.(ABC News: Maren Preuss)
", "With both domestic and international travel restarting, there are concerns about the different requirements between states, territories and countries.", "Carolyn Neilson is at Mathers House eating lunch with friends, before they clear the table for mahjong.", "She needed help to navigate the challenges of proving her full vaccination status\u00a0ahead of an upcoming trip to New Zealand.", "\"Where I live is a place called HOPES \u2014\u00a0Housing Options for People needing Extra Support \u2014\u00a0and the office lady there has done my initial certificate and my sister-in-law has kindly put it on my phone,\" she said.\u00a0", "\"I'm not techno savvy and I rely on the office staff and my sister-in-law.\u00a0", "", "
Grahame Rouleston and his wife want to travel to Europe to visit family.(ABC News: Maren Preuss)
", "Grahame Rouleston wants to travel to Europe with his wife to see family.\u00a0", "\"She wants to go home, she's 74, not that well, so she's keen to get over there and see her family in Ireland and Manchester and Bristol, she's got family all over the place,\" he said.\u00a0", "Mr Rouleston is worried about how they will find out the requirements for each destination.\u00a0", "The Council on the Ageing (COTA) has been lobbying the federal government and Services Australia to make processes more accessible.", "COTA says one of the challenges during the pandemic\u00a0has been that much of the government and other official information has only been published online.", "", "
\u00a0Council on the Ageing Tasmania chief executive Sue Leitch says more needs to be done to help those who don't have a smartphone.(ABC News: Selina Ross)
", "COTA Tasmania chief executive Sue Leitch\u00a0says there are a lot of complexities around the increasing societal reliance on smartphones.\u00a0", "\"Policy-makers generally need to think outside their square and think about the implications to a broader community,\" she said.\u00a0", "\"Some people don't have smartphones, they have older mobile phones, they're not used to actually taking their phones with them all the time.", "\"We know that people in lower socio-economic circumstances may only have phones that have very low data, if any data.", "\"We also know that people do live in regions that have low network strength and so access to online services is challenging, and we know there are people that have literacy issues beyond digital literacy.\"", "", "
Jonothan Davis does not own a smartphone.(ABC News: Selina Ross)
", "In the dining room at Mathers House, Jonothan Davis is tucking into lunch with his friend Margaret Grieve.\u00a0", "Mr Davis does not own a mobile phone and has to use paper forms in shops and venues to check in.\u00a0", "\"When you have to go and ask for it at the front of the counter, you feel like you're second rate,\" he said.\u00a0", "Mr Davis fears many\u00a0people will feel left behind or isolated.", "\"The reliance on smartphones is becoming like eventually you won't be able to live a normal life if you haven't got one,\" he said.", "Ms Grieve has also faced tech challenges during the pandemic.", "\"The problem I have sometimes is I've got arthritis in my hands, fingers, and so when I touch the app it doesn't do anything,\" she said.\u00a0", "\"I also have a tremor in my hand, the older you get the more problems there can be.\"", "Ms Grieve has also battled trying to remember to take her phone with her whenever she goes out and is worried about the need to have a vaccine certificate either on the device or on paper.", "\"If it was a card you could pop into your wallet it would be much easier,\" she said.", "\"I'd feel more secure, rather than having a piece of paper, it's just another thing you can leave behind.\"", "", "
Margaret Grieve sometimes has trouble using her smartphone because of arthritis and hand tremors(ABC News: Maren Preuss)
", "Paper copies of vaccination certificates can be obtained through Services Australia centres or by calling the National Immunisation Register on 1800 653 809.\u00a0", "COTA wants to see other solutions investigated, such as GPs being able to issue certified vaccine certificates or a smart Medicare card that contains personal vaccine information.", "Ms Leitch advises\u00a0turning to a friend or family member or a trusted community organisation for anyone needing help to access online services.", "\"We are dealing with people's sensitive information so it does need to be a trusted organisation when we're accessing data such as that,\" she said.", "\"It's part of the support that we give to people as well, about being careful with their data.\"", "", "
